#C language


First, learn a low-level language to understand the serect of computer, so


###[the C programming language](http://www.amazon.cn/C%E7%A8%8B%E5%BA%8F%E8%AE%BE%E8%AE%A1%E8%AF%AD%E8%A8%80-%E5%85%8B%E5%B0%BC%E6%B1%89/dp/B0011C9OMG/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1440862032&sr=1-3&keywords=c%E7%A8%8B%E5%BA%8F%E8%AE%BE%E8%AE%A1%E8%AF%AD%E8%A8%80)

######*by* Brian W.Kernighan & Dennis M.Ritchie


is what you'd better read.

#C++ language

Then, why not continue to learn relatives of C language's:)


I strongly recommed a book named

###[C++ primer](http://www.amazon.cn/C-Primer-%E6%9D%8E%E6%99%AE%E6%9B%BC/dp/B00CE43I04/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1440862471&sr=1-3&keywords=c+primer)

######*by* Stanley B.Lippman & Josee Lajoie & Barbara E.Moo

Oh maybe it's a fat book...
